thread.section_title: AllAfrica News: Economy, Business and Finance
thread.title: Kenya: COG Wants Farm Keys

title: Kenya: COG Wants Farm Keys
text:
Africa: Ethiopia Should Leave Africa By Ramadhan Rajab 
Governors have given the national government one week to hand over the function of licensing agricultural activities. Speaking at press conference yesterday, Council of Governor's Agriculture Committee chairman Nderitu Gachagua said even though Agriculture is devolved, the national government has refused to hand over all the functions. 
"Agriculture licensing belongs to the county governments. We have tried to reach out to the national government to have these function devolved but we have been frustrated by bureaucrats at Kilimo House," Gachagua said. 
"This is the end of the financial year and all licences have expired. As COG we direct all counties to take over functions under the Crop Act and starting next week." Kenya
